column4: hello! is there anyone who can help me with an NVIDIA problem?
applying the changes to /etc/X11/xorg.conf should make sure  starts with the right config :)
what do you mean by that?
well, you say you have to restart X after each reboot with a new xorg.conf file
ah, eny... it's a geforce 440 right?
and you've tried the restricted driver?
via the restricted driver manager... not via envy
ok, apparantly the 440 isn't supported by the unified driver anymore :(
checking up on some stuff, one moment :)
the restricted manager should offer you a legacy driver for your card
the manager is under system -> maintainance... you need the nvidia-glx-legacy package :)
with the "nvidia" driver listed in your xorg.conf file, quality is bad with the nvidia-glx-legacy driver?
then I can not suggest a better sollution, you could try the legacy drivers from the nvidia website :)
